intro: Blepharis cuanzensis subsp. tanganyikensis, commonly known as the Tanganyikan blepharis, is a flowering plant native to Tanzania. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and hairy leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
